content.question: Let v(t) be the velocity, in feet per second, of a skydiver at time t seconds, t ≥ 0. After her parachute opens, her velocity satisfies the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>v</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>v</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>32</mn> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca WGKbGaamODaaqaaiaadsgacaWG0baaaiabg2da9iabgkHiTiaaikda caWG2bGaeyOeI0IaaG4maiaaikdaaaa@3FDC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, with initial condition v(0) = −50. (a) Use separation of variables to find an expression for v in terms of t, where t is measured in seconds.

frqParts.text: Let v(t) be the velocity, in feet per second, of a skydiver at time t seconds, t ≥ 0. After her parachute opens, her velocity satisfies the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>v</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>v</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>32</mn> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca WGKbGaamODaaqaaiaadsgacaWG0baaaiabg2da9iabgkHiTiaaikda caWG2bGaeyOeI0IaaG4maiaaikdaaaa@3FDC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, with initial condition v(0) = −50. (a) Use separation of variables to find an expression for v in terms of t, where t is measured in seconds.

(b) Terminal velocity is defined as <math> <semantics> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>→</mo> <mi>∞</mi> </mrow> </munder> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaCbeaeaaci GGSbGaaiyAaiaac2gaaSqaaiaadshacqGHsgIRcqGHEisPaeqaaOGa amODaiaacIcacaWG0bGaaiykaaaa@40AD@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find the terminal velocity of the skydiver to the nearest foot per second.
(c) It is safe to land when her speed is 20 feet per second. At what time t does she reach this speed?

topic.text: 1.2: Defining Limits and Using Limit Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
